dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Deepfakes are just a harmless internet prank, right? But Kazakhstan is taking them very seriously with a new draft law.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deepfakes are just a harmless internet prank, right? But Kazakhstan is taking them very seriously with a new draft law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh citizens could soon face hefty fines for creating or distributing deepfake content, following the approval of a new draft law on artificial intelligence by the Mazhilis in a first reading on May 14.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, they just approved it in the Mazhilis on May 14th. It's their first real attempt to regulate AI, and uh, it's specifically targeting deepfake creation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, they just approved it in the Mazhilis on May fourteenth. It's their first real attempt to regulate A I, and uh, it's specifically targeting deepfake creation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh citizens could soon face hefty fines for creating or distributing deepfake content, following the approval of a new draft law on artificial intelligence by the Mazhilis in a first reading on May 14. Kazakhstan currently lacks a dedicated legal framework regulating AI.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the fines are no joke—they're talking about 15 to 100 monthly calculation indices, which could be up to like 393,000 tenge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the fines are no joke-they're talking about fifteen to one hundred monthly calculation indices, which could be up to like three hundred ninety three thousand tenge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The current proposal sets fines for the owners of such systems " ranging from 15 to 100 monthly calculation indices (from 58,000 to 393,000 tenge in 2025), depending on the type of business, Smyshlyayeva said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's aimed at the owners of the platforms or services used to make them, not necessarily just individual users.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's aimed at the owners of the platforms or services used to make them, not necessarily just individual users.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Mazhilis deputy Yekaterina Smyshlyayeva, the penalties will initially target owners of services or platforms used to create deepfakes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Yekaterina Smyshlyayeva mentioned they might even introduce criminal liability later, but that part isn't finalized yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Yekaterina Smyshlyayeva mentioned they might even introduce criminal liability later, but that part isn't finalized yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She added that lawmakers are also considering the possibility of introducing criminal liability for the dissemination of deepfakes, though this has yet to be finalized.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she said the Criminal Code is a serious tool that has to be used carefully. But it shows how worried they are about this tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she said the Criminal Code is a serious tool that has to be used carefully. But it shows how worried they are about this tech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Criminal Code is a serious tool that must be used with caution because it involves many legal components, she noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially since deepfakes can make it look like someone said or did something they never actually did—that's dangerous for misinformation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially since deepfakes can make it look like someone said or did something they never actually did-that's dangerous for misinformation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A deepfake is an image, video, or audio recording created using artificial intelligence to imitate real people. It can make it appear that someone said or did something they never actually did.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just for fun; some use it to deceive people. I mean, they've even banned ChatGPT for some government employees there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just for fun; some use it to deceive people. I mean, they've even banned ChatGPT for some government employees there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Deepfakes may be used for entertainment " or for deception. ChatGPT banned for some Kazakh government employees

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Really? So they're being super cautious about all generative AI, not just deepfakes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Really? So they're being super cautious about all generative A I, not just deepfakes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It feels like they're trying to get ahead of the problem before it spirals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It feels like they're trying to get ahead of the problem before it spirals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But defining what counts as a deepfake legally—that's gonna be tricky, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But defining what counts as a deepfake legally-that's gonna be tricky, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Punishment will be introduced once the legal definition is formulated and undergoes the required approvals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. They have to be precise, otherwise the law could be too broad or miss the mark entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. They have to be precise, otherwise the law could be too broad or miss the mark entirely.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's a big step for a country that didn't have any AI regulations before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, it's a big step for a country that didn't have any A I regulations before.
